comments:

This looks like a missing reference to a jar file in your plug-in. Please 
verify that there is an Eclipse problem that needs addressing.
This may indicate a problem in the 2.1 -> 3.0 compatibility story.

Is this a 2.1 plugin?  That is, does the plugin.xml for this plugin -not- have 
the following tag at the top: <?eclipse version="3.0"?>
Does it have a dependency on org.eclipse.ui?

If so, this should have gotten re-written by the runtime to include 
org.eclipse.ui.views.

Created an attachment (id=7986)
plugin.xml file

I attached the plugin.xml file of the plugin. As I am not the author, it would
possibly help to search contact through the plugins homepage (as mentioned
above).

The plugin.xml does not have the 3.0 tag and includes org.eclipse.ui.
Its prerequisites should be getting rewritten to include org.eclipse.ui.views.
Pascal, can you confirm that the runtime does this, or can you point me at the 
code (actually I'd like to know where this is done anyway)?

A simple test plugin shows that a pre-3.0 plugin depending on org.eclipse.ui 
can access org.eclipse.ui.views.contentoutline.IContentOutlinePage.

Ilja, was there anything in the log prior to the stack above?  E.g. anything 
indicating failure to start org.eclipse.ui.views or any other plugin?

Created an attachment (id=7994)
log file

log file for a fresh start of eclipse, followed by opening a JasperAssistant
editor.

What I noticed are the Exceptions regarding the linux file monitor. I am
working under windows on an installation for both linux *and* windows, and
besides those exceptions in the log file, it seems to work fine.

The code that does the prerequisite transformation is available in 
PluginParser#getRequires().
Also, which GEF are you running?  2.1.2 or more recent?
I am running GEF 2.1.2, as far as I can tell.

Andrew, can you see whether you can reproduce the problem here?
The Jasper download is in my public dir.
GEF 2.1.2 can be obtained here: http://www.eclipse.org/gef/

I got the following error when trying to enable GEF 2.1.2 in M7.

    "Graphical Editing Framework (2.1.2): Feature requires plug-in "org.eclipse.
platform (2.1.2)", or compatible."

Ilja, do you remember seeing this error message as well?  Any idea how I can get 
around it?

Is there a chance you're using a version of GEF other than 2.1.2 (the version 
tags on the gef plugin folders in the plugins dir would be a good way to tell).

Given the constraint (gef requires platform (2.1.2)", or compatible."), your 
only hope is to get a gef drop that works with 3.0.
Apparently they have something for M7.

Ilja, with GEF installed in your 3.0 Eclipse, what version numbers show for its 
plugins in Help > About > Plugin Details?

It does show 2.1.2

If I remember correctly, I followed the instructions on some plugins page to 
simply remove the dependency on Eclipse 2 from GEF's plugin.xml.

The gef manifest got generated as:

Generated-from: 1066243556000
Bundle-Name: Graphical Editing Framework

 org.eclipse.gef.ui.palette.customize,

Require-Bundle:

 org.eclipse.core.resources; provide-packages=true,
 org.eclipse.ui; provide-packages=true,
 org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility

Which seems to come from this part of the gef (2.1.2) plugin.xml:

   <requires>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.draw2d" export="true" version="2.1.2"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.runtime" export="true"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.resources" export="true"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ui" export="true"/>
   </requires>

The generated manifest is missing the org.eclipse.ui.views and the other 
dependencies normally added by the compatibility transform.

When looking for org.eclipse.ui, the manifest converter was getting confused 
because of the export or the optional statement.

A fix has been released in HEAD.
It fixes this problem as well as errors in the addition of the re-export clause.
For example when org.eclipse.ui was re-exported, the automatically added 
prerequisite where not properly re-exported.
I also get rid of the special checks for runtime.
